slides.title: Introduction to Contingencies
slides.notes: Introduction to the concept of contingencies in PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: Welcome to our journey into contingencies within Guidewire PolicyCenter, a crucial aspect when handling policy issuance dependent on additional information. As developers, understanding how contingencies work can significantly impact the flexibility and efficiency of policy management. Today, we'll explore how contingencies allow us to attach necessary documents or information, ensuring that policies are issued correctly and in compliance with underwriting guidelines. Let's dive in and see how these contingencies are structured and configured within the system.

slides.title: Understanding the Role of Contingencies
slides.notes: Set context for contingencies as they relate to policy issuance.
slides.narration: Contingencies play a vital role when policies are issued with conditions that need fulfillment post-issuance. Think of scenarios where a policy is issued with a good driver discount, but the actual discount hinges on receiving a student's report card. Contingencies help ensure that these requirements are tracked and fulfilled, reducing the risk of policy errors and ensuring compliance. We'll soon look into how PolicyCenter facilitates this through its robust contingency management tools.

slides.title: How Contingencies are Integrated into PolicyCenter
slides.notes: Discuss integration points within PolicyCenter for contingencies.
slides.narration: In PolicyCenter, contingencies are seamlessly integrated as part of the policy itself. This integration means that all contingent information is accessible and manageable directly within the policy lifecycle. We utilize specific entities and data model configurations to manage these contingencies, ensuring they are properly attached and tracked. This approach allows for efficient management of the policy issuance process, aligning with business needs and underwriting requirements.

slides.title: Configuration and Methods for Contingencies
slides.originalNotes:
Contingencies
There are times when a policy is issued, but the issuance is dependent on the delivery ofanother piece of information ordocument . For example, even if you issue a policy with a good driver discount, you still need to obtain a copy of the student’s report card. PolicyCenter has an option called "Contingencies“ which gives the user a chance to attach documents related tocontingent issuance. Contingency-related documents can be added to policies that are either issued or not yet issued. Contingencies are part of the policy. They provide a specificplace where contingency-related information can be attached.

 Configuration developers needing to configure contingencies should refer to the main configuration class.
ContingencyEnhancementgsx, to find relevant methods. The batch processes associated with Contingencies are:
1. Handle Unresolved Contingency, and
2. Recalculate Contingency Action Start Date.
Additional details are available in the product documentation.

slides.narration: Now, let's walk through adding a contingency to a policy in PolicyCenter. Start by accessing a policy that is not yet issued. Navigate to the Risk Analysis section, where you'll find the option to add a contingency under the Contingencies tab. Here, you can specify the contingency details, including a name, description, due date, and the actions to be taken if the contingency is not resolved. Observe how the system allows adding notes, documents, and activities related to the contingency, providing a comprehensive view of any outstanding requirements tied to the policy.

slides.title: Exploring Contingency Actions
slides.notes: Detail the types of actions that can be associated with contingencies.
slides.narration: With contingencies, we can define specific actions that are triggered based on their resolution status. These actions might involve policy changes, cancellations, or even rewrites, depending on the business logic configured in PolicyCenter. The base configuration provides pre-configured start and effective dates for these actions, ensuring that they align with the policy's lifecycle events. Understanding these possible actions helps developers ensure that contingencies are effectively managed and resolved within the system.

slides.title: Managing Contingency-Related Documents and Activities
slides.notes: Explain how to manage documents and activities related to contingencies.
slides.narration: Contingencies in PolicyCenter aren't just about tracking requirements—they also involve managing associated documents and activities. Adding notes, documents, or activities to a contingency is similar to how you would manage these elements for a policy or account. This capability provides flexibility in managing documentation and communication, ensuring that all stakeholders have access to the necessary information throughout the policy lifecycle. Such integration enhances the visibility and traceability of contingent requirements.

slides.title: Resolving Contingencies
slides.notes: Process of resolving contingencies and updating their status in PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: Resolving a contingency in PolicyCenter is a straightforward process that updates the policy's status based on the resolution outcome. Once a contingency is resolved, you'll see its status updated in the system, including the completion date and any actions taken. This resolution process ensures that contingencies are not only tracked but also addressed, preventing potential issues with policy compliance and underwriting requirements. It’s crucial for developers to understand how these resolutions are captured and reflected in the policy data.

slides.title: Practical Scenarios for Contingencies
slides.notes: Discuss real-world scenarios where contingencies are applicable.
slides.narration: Contingencies are particularly useful in scenarios that require additional documentation or approval post-policy issuance. For instance, a policy might be contingent upon receiving proof of a smoke alarm installation or a home appraisal. These real-world scenarios highlight the importance of contingencies in maintaining policy compliance and fulfilling underwriting conditions. By implementing contingencies, PolicyCenter ensures that all necessary criteria are met before a policy becomes fully effective.

slides.title: Troubleshooting Common Issues with Contingencies
slides.notes: Discuss common issues that might arise with contingencies and how to troubleshoot them.
slides.narration: Despite their importance, contingencies can sometimes present challenges, such as unresolved statuses or incorrect document attachments. Troubleshooting these issues often involves checking the configuration in ContingencyEnhancement.gs and ensuring that batch processes are running correctly. Familiarity with the underlying data model and relationships can also assist in diagnosing and addressing these problems. By proactively identifying and resolving these issues, you can maintain the integrity of the contingency management process.

slides.title: Best Practices for Managing Contingencies
slides.notes: Outline best practices for effective contingency management in PolicyCenter.
slides.narration: To effectively manage contingencies, it’s essential to follow best practices such as maintaining clear documentation, regularly reviewing contingency statuses, and ensuring timely resolution. These practices help streamline the policy issuance process and enhance communication among stakeholders. Furthermore, leveraging PolicyCenter’s configuration options enables a more flexible and responsive approach to managing contingencies. By adhering to these best practices, you'll ensure that contingencies support rather than hinder policy management.
